SENT.plain: Aspergillosis remains to be a life-threatening complication in immunocompromised patients
However, Aspergillus infection can be observed in non-immunocompromised individuals in rare cases
We report a case of liver aspergilloma in a chronic aplastic anemia patient under relatively intact immune status
Therapeutic strategy for this rare condition was extensively discussed and caspofungin acetate single agent first-line therapy was applied after careful consideration
Encouraging clinical and radiologic improvements were achieved in response to the antifungal salvage
Our long-term follow-up study also revealed a favorable prognosis
Based on this experience, we suggest caspofungin acetate as first-line therapy for treatment plans of liver aspergilloma
